alert.note: Alert for Bedford; Somerset (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 20 at 12:57AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT PARTS OF BEDFORD...SOMERSET...BLAIR... CAMBRIA...AND HUNTINGDON COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A snow squall accompanied by winds of up to 40 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one half of a mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 1256 AM EST, a band of snow squalls was along a line extending from 15 miles north of Ebensburg to near Westmont to near Connellsville and moving east at 35 MPH. THIS SQUALL WILL BE NEAR... Northern Cambria around 100 AM EST. Hastings around 105 AM EST. Carrolltown around 110 AM EST. Westmont, Johnstown and East Conemaugh around 115 AM EST. Belmont, Prince Gallitzin State Park and Geistown around 120 AM EST. Windber, South Fork and Ehrenfeld around 125 AM EST. This includes the following Interstates... The Pennsylvania Turnpike from mile markers 100 to 131. Interstate 99 from mile markers 9 to 49. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
